{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Norton |model=Core |revision=318 (Mini) |series=AC1300 |asin= |manuf_country=China |is_manuf=No |manuf=Foxconn |type=range extender, mesh node |fcc_date=09/04/2018 |fcc_id=2AI6F-318 |ic_id=21721-318 |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=1.5 |pwr_conn=barrel |cpu1_brand=Qualcomm |cpu1_model=IPQ4018 |cpu1_cspeed=700 |cpu1_cores=4 |fla1=4 GiB |fla1_brand=Kingston |fla1_model=EMMC04G-M627 |ram1=512 |ram1_brand=Samsung |ram1_model=K4B4G1646E-BYK0 |wi1_chip1_brand=Qualcomm |wi1_chip1_model=IPQ4018 |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi1_txchains=2 |wi1_rxchains=2 |wi1_sstreams=2 |wi2_chip1_brand=Qualcomm |wi2_chip1_model=IPQ4018 |wi2_802dot11_protocols=an+ac |wi2_txchains=2 |wi2_rxchains=2 |wi2_sstreams=2 |eth_cpu=true |sw_brand=Qualcomm Atheros |sw_model=QCA8072 |lan_speed=1GbE |lan_ports=1 |wan_speed=1GbE |wan_ports=1 |flags=Bluetooth LE, |802dot11_protocols=abgn+ac |oui=B4:A9:84 |oui_eth=B4:A9:84 }}
:• '''867''' Mbps - 2SS 5GHz [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_802.11ac#Data_rates_and_speed 802.11ac] (80MHz chan.), :• '''400''' Mbps - 2SS 2.4GHz [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_802.11n-2009#Data_rates 802.11n] (40MHz chan., 256QAM) = '''''1300 Mbps'' class'''
{{TagLine|Secure Wireless Satellite Norton Core Mini}} "PATHFINDER_MAIN_BOARD" and "REV:1.02" are silkscreened on the main board in the FCC photos. This device is assumed to be a range extender intended to be used with the larger Norton Core routers. :It likely contains a [[Qualcomm]] IPQ4018/IPQ4019. FCC documents refer to the [[Norton Core 518]] in some places, likely by mistake. {{See also|Norton Core 517|Norton Core 518}} __NOTOC__
